comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The New York City garbage strike was put down by a massive hiring of strikebreakers, but outbursts of resistance continued until the end of November, as documented by stories in The New York Times. Cleanup efforts dragged on into December. "Strikers Plead to be Taken Back" New York Times story, November 21, 1911: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9A02E3DC1231E2...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Seven of these 14 photos bear the date 11/13/11; the other seven are undated.

comment.author: 34997905@N03
comment._content: Dear CaroleGmomof3: I imagine you can learn more about the 1911 garbage strike in a book on New York City history. Here are a couple of titles which sounded interesting to me from our catalog. They may be available at a library near you: 1) Main Title: The Greater city, New York, 1898-1948 / edited by Allan Nevins and John A. Krout. Published/Created: Westport, Conn. : Greenwood Press, 1981, c1948. lccn.loc.gov/81004173 2) Main Title: Incredible New York : high life and low life from 1850 to 1950 / Lloyd Morris. Edition Information: 1st Syracuse University Press ed. Published/Created: New York : Syracuse University Press, 1996. lccn.loc.gov/95046297 Hope this helps.
